author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Byron Leftwich Joins CU Buffs Coaching Staff with Deion Sanders
text:
Byron Leftwich Joins CU Buffs Coaching Staff with Deion Sanders
Byron Leftwich, former NFL quarterback and offensive coordinator, is set to join the coaching staff of the Colorado Buffaloes under head coach Deion Sanders. Though not officially confirmed by the university, Leftwich's addition comes as part of a broader effort to build a high-profile coaching team. Leftwich, who played 10 seasons in the NFL and coached most recently with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, has been visiting the program recently as a close friend of Sanders. His specific role with the Buffs remains unclear.
- Leftwich played 10 NFL seasons, starting for 24 games.
- As a Buccaneers offensive coordinator, he led the team to a Super Bowl victory in 2021.
- Sanders continues to build a star-studded coaching staff at CU.
- Leftwich has been involved with the program during Sanders's two previous seasons.
Expect further announcements regarding coaching hires from Sanders, as he hinted at additional significant moves in the coming weeks. The Buffs aim to enhance their competitive edge with a celebrated coaching team, possibly impacting recruitment and team performance.
Bottom LineThe addition of Byron Leftwich signals Colorado's commitment to elevating their football program, leveraging experienced former NFL players to attract both talent and attention. This move exemplifies a strategic approach to rebuilding the Buffs' coaching prowess.
Read more at Boulder Daily Camera
